intro: Gregoria vitaliana subsp. sesleri, commonly known as the Sesler's gregoria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to South Africa, particularly the Western Cape region, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in coastal and mountainous areas, adapting well to harsh, arid conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and collections worldwide.
